Who is Alex Pereira, and What is the UFC?

Alex Pereira is a professional mixed martial artist and former kickboxer from Brazil. He is currently the champion of the light heavyweight division in the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC), which is the premier organization in mixed martial arts (MMA). Known for his devastating striking ability and knockout power, Pereira has an MMA record of 12 wins, 2 losses, and no draws (12-2-0), with 10 of his victories coming by knockout. Before transitioning to MMA, Pereira achieved remarkable success in the Glory kickboxing organization, where he made history as the only fighter to be a simultaneous two-division champion.

A Captivating Rivalry

Before his UFC reign, Pereira had a stellar run in kickboxing.

Alex Pereira Kickboxing Career Timeline

Pereira defeated Israel Adesanya twice, once by knockout, during his kickboxing career.

Izzy shifted away from kickboxing after his second loss to Pereira. He would go on to find immense success and popularity in the UFC.

Israel Adesanya MMA Wins and Instagram Followers

Izzy rose to meteoric popularity as he continued to dominate in the UFC.

Adesanya had words for Pereira in a 2018 interview with Sporting News Australia.

“No one knows who the f*ck he is. When I'm a legend, he’s going to be at some pub talking some sh*t about I beat that guy one time.”

Pereira did not take that too kindly...

“There is…an interview with Israel Adesanya that motivated me so much. I felt challenged. And whenever there is a challenge, no one can hold me back.”

Pereira focused on MMA, where he dismantled his competition. He was fast-tracked to the UFC and a match against current UFC Middleweight Champion and past rival, Israel Adesanya.

UFC 281: Adesanya vs. Pereira

After already defeating him twice in another sport, Pereira found his way to Adesanya in the UFC and knocked him out.

Knockout Artist

Pereira has a greater percentage of knockouts as his wins than any other champion of a men's division in the UFC.

Fastest Ever to Three Title Defenses

Pereira broke Ronda Rousey's record when he achieved three title defenses in 175 days.

Greatness

Pereira is arguably the best striker in the history of the UFC. He has a higher striking accuracy than some of the most highly regarded strikers ever.
